head.supplied: 28/2/82. ¶ ¶ Best thanks, dear Mr Barnard, for kindly sending the new and valuable part of the R. S. papers. ¶ I have sent by this post already the copies, intended for Germany and Sweden. Let me th...

div.p: RSA/B.13(15), Royal Society of Tasmania Archives, Hobart.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
Best thanks, dear Mr Barnard, for kindly sending the new and valuable part of the R. S. papers.
Papers and proceedings of the Royal Society of Tasmania (1880), published early in 1882; see J. Barnard to M, 18 February 1882. The volume included a paper by M, namely B82.02.03. I have sent by this post already the copies, intended for Germany and Sweden. Let me thank the Council for the goodness of conceding me some space for a new contribution in your next issue; but I am still so much in arrear with my Departmental work since the long Extraengagements for the International Exhibition,
International Exhibition, Melbourne, 1880-1. that I cannot just now furnish an article. If mine could be accepted as the last for the new part, & you would kindly write me a few weeks prior to the actual publication of the same, I will gladly undertake to furnish my quota.
See M to J. Barnard, 17 March 1882, with which M sent a 'short paper', published in the next volume of the Society's Papers and proceedings as B82.13.14.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
